intro: Bactris brongniartii, commonly known as the pink palm, is a species of palm native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves that can reach up to 3 meters in length. The plant produces yellowish flowers and edible, round fruits that are similar in appearance to pineapples. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in humid, lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and agricultural purposes.
